content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the overall development of the poem?

choices.label: The speaker makes an extended, reasoned complaint to the lady before providing himself some thoughtful consolation.
The speaker imagines a dialogue with the lady, which provides him some measure of understanding.
The speaker uses varied strategies of questions and assertions in an effort to win the ladyâ€™s affections.
The speaker describes how his views are similar to those of the lady, then reverses his stance.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain the function of structure in a text.
